StringVector @151::getAttributes ( const std::wstring &  object  )  [static]

Extracts Python attributes from given object.

Attributes are assumed to be the list of keys in object's dir(). If object is empty, return globals and all Python 2.4 keywords.

StringVector @150::getAttributes ( const std::wstring &  object  )  [static]

StringPair @151::splitHeadAndExpression ( const std::wstring &  line  )  [static]

Splits given console line into two parts: head and expression.

The expression is the substring that currently matters in the context of code completion. The head is anything preceeding it. Return result as a std::pair of strings.

For example, in the line: "if BigWorld.entities[ BigWorld.player().targetI" Head would be: "if BigWorld.entities[ " And expression: "BigWorld.player().targetI"

StringPair @150::splitHeadAndExpression ( const std::wstring &  line  )  [static]

StringPair @151::splitObjAndAttr ( const std::wstring &  expression  )  [static]

Splits given expression line into two parts: object and attribute.

The object is the substring where potential matching attributes are extracted from. The attribute is anything succeding the last dot in the expression. Return result as a std::pair of strings.

For example, in the expresttion: "BigWorld.player().targetI" Expression would be: "BigWorld.player()" And attribute: "targetI"

StringPair @150::splitObjAndAttr ( const std::wstring &  expression  )  [static]
